item.title: Simulating 1000 flocking fish in Unreal Engine
item.description:
Introduction #

I’ve been exploring boids and flocking simulations recently. The emergent behavior from simple rules is interesting, so I implemented it to add life to a simple fishing game I made way back when. The target was to simulate a school of 1000 fish effectively.

The initial implementation used an AActor_Fish class with basic boids logic. When spawning 1000 instances, performance was around 6 FPS.

This post outlines the process of improving the simulation to over 70 FPS, while maintaining gameplay features like selecting and catching individual fish. It covers profiling, shifting from object-oriented to adhere to data-oriented design principles using Unreal Engine features.
